bibl.title: Chin Hing v. United States of America. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

div1.p: In the United States District Court, In and For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of Ching Hing, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2857 Order.

This matter coming on regularly to be heard, and the Petitioner Ching Hing, appearing by and through his Attorney, John J. Sullivan, and the United States Government, appearing by and through its attorney, Clay Allen, United States District Attorney, and George P. Fishburne, Assistant U.S. District Attorney, and the Court being fully advised in the premises and it being deemed fit and proper, the Court does fix the bond in the sum of Fifteen Hundred (1500) Dollars, and upon the giving of same by said petitioner, and upon approval by the District Attorney, and by this Court, the Petitioner shall be released upon said bond to await the further Order or Judgment of this Court.
Signed in open Court this 2nd day of March, 1915.
div1.ab: Edward E Cushman U.S. District Judge
